item.title: Getting started with tmux
item.description: Installation or Setup # In Ubuntu and Debian sudo apt-get install tmux In macOS brew install tmux

item.title: Basic usage
item.description: Windows # To create a window do a prefix followed by c ie, by default ctrlb followed by c To list all windows, do a prefix followed by w ie, by default ctrlb followed by w To rename current window, do a prefix followed by , ie, by default ctrlb followed by , Splitting panes # To split pane vertically, do a prefix followed by % ie, by default ctrlb followed by %

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Tmux configurations goes in a file called .tmux.conf in home directory. ie, ~/.tmux.conf Change prefix # The default configuration <C-b> is not the easiest to use. It’d be better to use something like ctrla. To do so, add this to tmux.conf # remap prefix from 'C-b' to 'C-a' unbind C-b set-option -g prefix C-a bind-key C-a send-prefix
